title: Triline font website?
content:
Does anyone know of a website that specifically showcases triline style fonts? Any help would be appreciated.

thanks
author: Tyler Lang

comments.content: I do not know of any sites specific to triline styles, but you can always try a keyword search at a distributor or foundry, [like this.](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018111759/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/keyword/triline/) [Another.](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018111759/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=EF.6453.0.5&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Pump+Triline&sampleSize=48)

The ' [Lined Font Identification Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018111759/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/LinedFontGuide01.html)', by fellow Typophile Mike Yanega.:  
_\> [www.bowfinprintworks.com/LinedFontGuide01.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018111759/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/LinedFontGuide01.html)_

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018111759/http:/www.formlos.net/)
Formlos, thank you. I found this site about a year ago and lost the address. This was the exact site I had in mind. Thanks!
Where has Mike been lately? I havent seen him in quite a while.
